active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the real-world consequences of exposed backup files (e.g., Equifax breach parallels) and propose mitigation strategies. Support arguments with OWASP A05:2021 references and voter consensus on risks like info disclosure leading to full compromise.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Backup File Discovery and Access' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Web Application Penetration Testing > 013_004_Configuration and Deployment Management Testing > Backup and Unreferenced Files > Backup File Discovery and Access). Base on provided research: Core concepts (pentesting, ethical hacking, backup discovery/access risks like creds/PII disclosure per OWASP A05:2021, CREST Penetration Testing Guide); extensions (.bak, .old, ~, .swp); tools (DirBuster, Gobuster, ffuf); techniques (fuzzing, traversal). Incorporate university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy objectives [insert learning_objectives array]; Active learning [discussion/peer/problem-solving]; 4-layer scaffolding [insert scaffolding object]. Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, each as: {'front': 'Question', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'blooms_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'active_learning_tie': '...'}}, following flashcard_schema exactly. Use distractor_protocol for MCQs. Ensure 10 cards per Bloom's level distribution, balanced layers. Prioritize voter consensus: measurable LOs, tools/procedures, prior knowledge links, big picture (info disclosure to compromise).
